profileText: a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Tinicum Township, Delaware County, Pa., October 7, 1773; resided in Tinicum Township, Delaware County, Pa.; member of the State house of representatives, 1808-1812; elected as a Federalist to the Fourteenth Congress (March 4, 1815-March 3, 1817); moved to Darby Township (later Darby Borough) in 1815; justice of the peace at the time of his death in Darby, Delaware County, Pa., on January 27, 1846; interment in Episcopal Church of Saint James Kingsessing Churchyard, Philadelphia, Pa.

note.content: One of four elected to represent 1st district.
